title: Giant Banners with Trump's Face on Federal Buildings
summary: Trump administration spent at least $50,000 in taxpayer funds for giant banners featuring Trump's face or policies on federal buildings in Washington DC. Department of Agriculture: $16,400. HHS: $33,726. Department of Labor: $6,000 for 88-foot banner with Trump's 'glowering second inaugural portrait' and 'American Workers First.' Sen. Adam Schiff report exposed spending, called it illegal propaganda violating federal spending laws since 1951 prohibiting taxpayer spending 'for publicity or propaganda purposes.' Critics compared to totalitarian dictators. Trump administration planned additional propaganda banners.
